svcsubproc.para: The antilock system provides individual wheel control by using a wheel speed sensor and modulator at each wheel to measure rotational speed. By monitoring the rate of deceleration during braking, and then modifying the service brake application pressure at each wheel, the EC-15 is able to provide improved vehicle braking, while maintaining vehicle stability.

The rear axle brakes are controlled completely independent of each other and brake application pressure at an individual wheel is adjusted solely on the basis of its behavior on the road surface on which it is traveling.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Axle Brake Operation With 6x4 Chassis
svcsubproc.para: With vehicles equipped with tandem rear axles (6x2 or 6x4), the wheel speed sensors are installed at the wheels, located on the axle that is most likely to lose traction first. With a 4-spring suspension, the rear axle sensors are located on the Forward Rear axle. On an air suspension, sensors are located on the Rear Rear axle. A single modulator controls both left side rear axle brakes and another modulator controls both right side rear axle brakes. With this arrangement of wheel speed sensors and modulators, both brakes on one side of a tandem rear axle will be modulated as one, since they will most likely be on the same type of road surface.

svcsubproc.title: Front (Steering) Axle Brake Operation
svcsubproc.para: While each steering axle brake is under the control of an individual modulator valve, the EC-15 does not treat these brakes totally independent of each other. The EC-15 utilizes a modified individual control method for steering axle brakes. This is done to minimize "steering wheel pull" in the event that one front wheel is on dry pavement and the other is on a slippery surface, such as ice or snow. The EC-15 controls the braking force differences between the two brakes. The wheel on dry pavement is initially given less braking force and is brought up to optimum during the stop, while the wheel on ice attempts to maintain optimum braking during the entire stop.

svcsubproc.title: Non-Antilock Brake Application: Rear Axle(s)
svcsubproc.para: During normal braking, control air pressure from the brake valve (foot valve) enters the service port of the service relay valve (part of the CR-15 Relay Valve/EC-15 assembly). The relay valve also receives air from the vehicle's primary air reservoir. The service relay delivers air to, and through, the antilock modulators located near the braked wheel(s), and into the brake actuator. The service brakes are thus applied. If the wheel sensors do not detect an impending wheel lockup, the EC-15 does not initiate any corrective action and the vehicle comes to a stop in a normal fashion.

svcsubproc.title: Non-Antilock Brake Application: Front Axle (Steering Axle)
svcsubproc.para: During normal braking, air pressure from the brake valve (foot valve) is applied to the quick release valve (QRV). Air from the QRV is then sent to the right and left front M-21 wheel modulator valves. The M-21 antilock modulators then deliver the brake air pressure to the brake actuators. The service brakes are thus applied. If the wheel sensors do not detect an impending wheel lockup, the EC-15 does not initiate any corrective action and the vehicle comes to a stop in a normal fashion.

svcsubproc.title: Antilock Controlled Brake Application - System Fully Operational
svcsubproc.para: If a service brake application is made and the wheel speed sensors detect an impending wheel lockup, the EC-15 will immediately begin modification of brake application using the M-21 antilock modulator(s) at the wheel(s) sensing an impending lockup condition.

Solenoid valves contained in the modulator are rapidly energized and de-energized by the EC-15 in order to modify the brake application. When a solenoid coil is energized, its shuttle moves, and depending upon the function of the specific solenoid, it either opens or closes, thereby causing the exhaust or re-application of air pressure to the brake actuator. By opening and closing the solenoid valves in the appropriate modulator, the EC-15 is actually simulating what the driver does when he "pumps the brakes." Unlike the driver, the EC-15 receives input on which wheel is approaching lockup, and is able to pump each brake group on the vehicle independently and with far greater speed and accuracy.

svcsubproc.title: Antilock System Operation - Component Failure
svcsubproc.para: The EC-15 handles equipment failure using a conservative fail-safe philosophy. Any single electrical failure of an antilock system component results in three events happening at the same time. The three events are:

step1.para: The yellow antilock warning light on the instrument panel will illuminate to alert the driver that the system has detected a malfunction.
The EC-15 will disable all or part of the antilock system.

svcsubproc.para: When coping with wheel equipment (modulator, wheel sensor/exciter ring or associated wire harness) failure, the EC-15 divides and separates the brakes diagonally. For example, if the modulator at the right front wheel has a broken wire lead, the EC-15 disables the antilock function for BOTH the right front and left rear wheels. The antilock will continue to function on the left front and right wheels and will continue to be controlled by the EC-15.

note.para: Right and left, and front and rear are determined from the driver's seat position. Left front would be the front corner closest to the driver.

svcsubproc.para: Depending on the type of failure, and location of the failed component, the EC-15 will disable either the entire antilock system or only a portion of the antilock system, as previously described. An antilock system power failure (less than 9V) or failure of the EC-15 will cause the system to shut down, reverting to a standard braking system. Also failure of two or more components will cause the entire system to shut down, and again revert to a standard brake system.
With the failed component approach previously described, a partially shutdown antilock brake system will still provide improved braking stability over a standard air brake system.

note.para: With a partially shutdown antilock brake system, the driver will be alerted by the instrument panel warning light, and the portion of the antilock system disabled by the EC-15 reverts to a standard air brake system controlled by the relay valve (rear axles) or brake valve (front axle).
